    • Method Detail

      • getPossibleStartTimes

        public java.util.Set<org.joda.time.DateTime> getPossibleStartTimes(Task task,
                                                          int amount,
                                                          org.joda.time.DateTime earliestPossibleStartTime)
        Returns a set of possible starting times for the task. These are the (amount) first times that the required resources for the task are available starting from the earliest possible starting time.
        Parameters:
        task - The task of which the starting times will be gathered
        amount - The amount of starting times that will be gathered
        earliestPossibleStartTime - The earliest time that the task should be started
        Returns:
        Returns a set of possible starting times for the task.

      • isValidTimeSpan

        public boolean isValidTimeSpan(Task task,
                      TimeSpan timeSpan,
                      org.joda.time.DateTime earliestPossibleStartTime)
        Checks if the timespan is valid for the task. It is valid if it is after the earliest possible starting time and all the required resources are available for the entire duration.
        Parameters:
        task - The task for which this will be checked for
        timeSpan - The timespan for which will be checked if it is valid for the task
        earliestPossibleStartTime - The earliest possible starting time for the task
        Returns:
        Returns whether or not the timespan is valid for the task.
